chapter: Chapter Four - The Bill of Rights

rights.title: Right to Life
rights.description: Every person has the right to life. The life of a person begins at conception.
key_provisions: Right to life for every person
Life begins at conception
No intentional deprivation of life except as authorized by Constitution
Abortion permitted only for emergency treatment or when mother's life/health is in danger

rights.title: Equality and Freedom from Discrimination
rights.description: Every person is equal before the law and has the right to equal protection and benefit of the law.
key_provisions: Equal treatment before the law
Equal opportunities for men and women
No discrimination based on race, sex, pregnancy, marital status, health, ethnic origin, color, age, disability, religion, culture, dress, language or birth
State must take affirmative action to address past discrimination
Not more than two-thirds of elective/appointive bodies shall be of same gender

rights.title: Human Dignity
rights.description: Every person has inherent dignity and the right to have that dignity respected and protected.
key_provisions: Inherent dignity for every person
Right to respect and protection of dignity

rights.title: Freedom and Security of the Person
rights.description: Every person has the right to freedom and security, including protection from arbitrary detention, violence, torture, and cruel treatment.
key_provisions: Right to freedom and security
No arbitrary deprivation of freedom
No detention without trial (except during emergency)
No violence from public or private sources
No torture, corporal punishment, or cruel treatment

rights.title: Freedom from Slavery, Servitude and Forced Labour
rights.description: No person shall be held in slavery or servitude, or required to perform forced labour.
key_provisions: No slavery or servitude
No forced labour

rights.title: Right to Privacy
rights.description: Every person has the right to privacy, including protection of personal space, property, family affairs, and communications.
key_provisions: Right to privacy
No unreasonable search of person, home, or property
No seizure of possessions without justification
Protection of family and private affairs
Privacy of communications

rights.title: Freedom of Conscience, Religion, Belief and Opinion
rights.description: Every person has the right to freedom of conscience, religion, thought, belief and opinion.
key_provisions: Freedom of conscience, religion, thought, belief and opinion
Right to manifest religion through worship, practice, teaching
No denial of access to institutions due to belief or religion
No compulsion to act against one's belief or religion

rights.title: Freedom of Expression
rights.description: Every person has the right to freedom of expression, including seeking, receiving and imparting information, artistic creativity, and academic freedom.
key_provisions: Freedom to seek, receive, and impart information
Freedom of artistic creativity
Academic freedom and scientific research
Excludes propaganda for war, incitement to violence, hate speech

rights.title: Freedom of the Media
rights.description: Freedom and independence of electronic, print and all other types of media is guaranteed.
key_provisions: Freedom and independence of all media
No state control or interference with media
No penalization for opinions, views, or content
Freedom of media establishment subject to licensing
State-owned media must be impartial and independent

rights.title: Access to Information
rights.description: Every citizen has the right to access information held by the State and other persons for protection of rights.
key_provisions: Right to access information held by the State
Right to access information from others for rights protection
Right to correction of untrue or misleading information
State must publish important national information

rights.title: Freedom of Association
rights.description: Every person has the right to form, join, or participate in associations of any kind.
key_provisions: Right to form, join, or participate in associations
No compulsion to join associations
Fair registration processes for associations
Right to fair hearing before registration cancellation

rights.title: Assembly, Demonstration, Picketing and Petition
rights.description: Every person has the right to peaceably and unarmed assemble, demonstrate, picket, and petition public authorities.
key_provisions: Right to peaceful and unarmed assembly
Right to demonstrate
Right to picket
Right to petition public authorities

rights.title: Political Rights
rights.description: Every citizen has the right to make political choices, participate in elections, and hold public office.
key_provisions: Right to form and participate in political parties
Right to campaign for political causes
Right to free, fair and regular elections
Right to vote by secret ballot
Right to be registered as voter
Right to be candidate for public office

rights.title: Freedom of Movement and Residence
rights.description: Every person has the right to freedom of movement, and every citizen has the right to enter, remain in, and reside anywhere in Kenya.
key_provisions: Right to freedom of movement
Right to leave Kenya
Right for citizens to enter, remain, and reside anywhere in Kenya

rights.title: Protection of Right to Property
rights.description: Every person has the right to acquire and own property, with protection against arbitrary deprivation.
key_provisions: Right to acquire and own property anywhere in Kenya
No arbitrary deprivation of property
Compensation required for public acquisition of property
Protection of intellectual property rights
Rights don't extend to unlawfully acquired property

rights.title: Labour Relations
rights.description: Every person has the right to fair labour practices, including fair remuneration, reasonable working conditions, and the right to strike.
key_provisions: Right to fair labour practices
Right to fair remuneration
Right to reasonable working conditions
Right to form and join trade unions
Right to strike
Right to collective bargaining

rights.title: Right to Environment
rights.description: Every person has the right to a clean and healthy environment for present and future generations.
key_provisions: Right to clean and healthy environment
Environmental protection for present and future generations
Legislative and other protective measures required

rights.title: Economic and Social Rights
rights.description: Every person has the right to healthcare, housing, food, water, social security, and education.
key_provisions: Right to highest attainable standard of health
Right to accessible and adequate housing
Right to be free from hunger and have adequate food
Right to clean and safe water
Right to social security
Right to education
Right to emergency medical treatment

rights.title: Language and Culture
rights.description: Every person has the right to use their language and participate in cultural life of their choice.
key_provisions: Right to use one's language
Right to participate in cultural life of choice
Right to form cultural and linguistic associations
No compulsion to perform cultural practices against one's will

rights.title: Family Rights
rights.description: The family is the fundamental unit of society with rights to marriage, equality in marriage, and state protection.
key_provisions: Family as fundamental unit of society
Right to marry person of opposite sex based on free consent
Equal rights in marriage and at dissolution
Recognition of traditional and religious marriages
State protection of family

rights.title: Consumer Rights
rights.description: Consumers have rights to quality goods and services, information, protection, and compensation.
key_provisions: Right to goods and services of reasonable quality
Right to necessary information about goods and services
Right to protection of health, safety, and economic interests
Right to compensation for defective goods or services

rights.title: Fair Administrative Action
rights.description: Every person has the right to administrative action that is expeditious, efficient, lawful, reasonable and procedurally fair.
key_provisions: Right to expeditious, efficient, lawful, reasonable and fair administrative action
Right to written reasons for administrative action
Right to review of administrative action by courts or tribunals

rights.title: Access to Justice
rights.description: The State shall ensure access to justice for all persons with reasonable fees that don't impede access.
key_provisions: Right to access to justice for all persons
Reasonable fees that don't impede access to justice

rights.title: Rights of Arrested Persons
rights.description: Arrested persons have rights including to be informed of charges, remain silent, legal representation, and timely court appearance.
key_provisions: Right to be informed of reason for arrest
Right to remain silent
Right to communicate with advocate
Right not to be compelled to confess
Right to be brought before court within 24 hours
Right to be released on bail unless compelling reasons exist

rights.title: Fair Hearing
rights.description: Every person has the right to fair and public hearing, and accused persons have extensive rights to fair trial.
key_provisions: Right to fair and public hearing
Right to be presumed innocent until proven guilty
Right to be informed of charges with sufficient detail
Right to adequate time and facilities for defense
Right to public trial
Right to legal representation
Right to remain silent
Right to challenge evidence
Right to interpreter if needed
Right to appeal

rights.title: Rights of Detained Persons
rights.description: Detained persons retain all rights except those incompatible with detention, and have right to humane treatment.
key_provisions: Retention of all rights except those incompatible with detention
Right to petition for habeas corpus
Right to humane treatment
Legislative protection required

rights.title: Rights of Children
rights.description: Every child has rights to name, nationality, education, nutrition, healthcare, protection from abuse, and parental care.
key_provisions: Right to name and nationality from birth
Right to free and compulsory basic education
Right to basic nutrition, shelter and healthcare
Right to protection from abuse, neglect, harmful practices, and violence
Right to parental care and protection
Best interests of child are paramount

rights.title: Rights of Persons with Disabilities
rights.description: Persons with disabilities have rights to dignity, access to education, public facilities, communication aids, and representation.
key_provisions: Right to dignity and respect
Right to access educational institutions
Right to reasonable access to places, transport, and information
Right to use sign language, braille, or other communication means
Right to assistive materials and devices
At least 5% representation in public bodies

rights.title: Rights of Youth
rights.description: The State shall ensure youth access to education, training, opportunities for participation, employment, and protection from exploitation.
key_provisions: Right to relevant education and training
Right to opportunities for participation in all spheres of life
Right to access employment
Right to protection from harmful practices and exploitation

rights.title: Rights of Minorities and Marginalised Groups
rights.description: The State shall ensure minorities and marginalised groups participate in governance and have special opportunities in education and employment.
key_provisions: Right to participate and be represented in governance
Right to special opportunities in education and economic fields
Right to special employment opportunities
Right to develop cultural values, languages, and practices
Right to reasonable access to water, health services, and infrastructure

rights.title: Rights of Older Persons
rights.description: The State shall ensure older persons can participate in society, pursue development, live in dignity, and receive care.
key_provisions: Right to fully participate in society
Right to pursue personal development
Right to live in dignity and be free from abuse
Right to receive reasonable care from family and State

usage_instructions.rotation_logic: Use the 'id' field to cycle through rights. You can use: currentRightId = (dayOfYear % totalRights) + 1
usage_instructions.display_format: Show the title, description, and key_provisions for each right
